title: Peter Paul Simmons on activism- author perspective

content.question: Which of the following best explains the significance of Simmons’s perspective?

choices.label: As an abolitionist speaking in the 1830s, Simmons may have been influenced by calls for violence against slavery among advocates of radical resistance.
As an African American speaker in the nineteenth century, Simmons’s message may have been influenced by the support he received from white people in the South.
As a person enslaved in the South in 1839, Simmons’s attitude may have been shaped by the growth of the slave trade between the upper and lower South.
As a resident of the North in the early 1800s, Simmons may not have known many details about the extent of slavery or the treatment of enslaved people in the South.

content.answer: As an abolitionist speaking in the 1830s, Simmons may have been influenced by calls for violence against slavery among advocates of radical resistance.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's perspective, purpose, context, and audience.
